triples.name: K-means clustering
triples.relevance: K-means is the foundational clustering method that the paper extends with the proposed unsupervised variant.

triples.name: Unsupervised learning
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the unsupervised learning paradigm and proposes a method that operates without labeled data.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: Clustering is the core task that the paper aims to improve through automatic cluster number determination.

triples.name: Pattern recognition
triples.relevance: Pattern recognition is cited as a key application domain where the proposed clustering method can be applied.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is the broader field within which the clustering problem and algorithm are situated.

triples.name: Automatic clustering algorithms
triples.relevance: The paper proposes U-k-means, an unsupervised clustering algorithm that automatically determines the optimal number of clusters without initialization.
